website_summaries.verdict: The type of gravel bike to choose when you are looking for an affordable upgrade from an entry-level bike.
pros: Solid construction along the tube joints will keep the frame together during heavy bumps and dips
Light enough to carry around and race with decent results
cons: Limited choice of compatible tire widths

customer_reviews.title: It's a ok bike, but was hoping for a better bike
customer_reviews.text: It's an ok bike. It seems like it should be priced around 200$. It seemed really nice at first, but after using it for a few weeks it seems to be cheaper construction. Rubber hand grips are loose and already have wear and tear. The brake system and gear shifters should be better quality. It's not a terrible bike, but I thought it would be better. If it was priced around 200$ then I would of been happy with it compared to 300$.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: This is the best bike for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike. First I'm 6' 7" and the 22 inch bike fits me well. Second the bike was easy to put together and is very light weight. Third it has a smooth ride and handles bike trails well. This is a well designed hybrid and for the price buy this bike. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: tyrone l ellis sr

customer_reviews.title: For what I need, perfect
customer_reviews.text: It's a well built, middle of the road hybrid. For the price and my intended use, a great buy. Easy to put together but tune by a professional. Wish the tires were a little higher quality, but that's a small drawback. It's not an elite bike, but an affordable everyday option for paved trails and city riding.
customer_reviews.author: Avec Nourriture

customer_reviews.title: Overall great bike
customer_reviews.text: This bike was pretty easy to put together. The seat had to be adjusted a few times to stop shifting around and tipping backwards. I like the placement of the kickstand, as it's behind the pedals instead of in line with them, so they don't get in the way of each other when you're trying to move the bike out of the garage. One thing I don't like is that it doesn't have a pass-through bar. It's tricky to mount and dismount. Other than that, it's a great bike.
customer_reviews.author: HA

customer_reviews.title: Great City Bike!
customer_reviews.text: Nice design! Great bike for city travel and gears are perfect for city hills. The bike was purchased primarily for a student to travel from home to college.

customer_reviews.title: Received with broken/missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Bike was received with a broken off front white reflector and a missing screw from the left brake. I called the manufacturer/marketer and requested a call back, but no one ever called. I hope this can be returned soon. Waited a couple weeks to write the review thinking the manufacturer would be able to respond. Now guess how bad the service is once you bought the product.
customer_reviews.author: Steffi S.

customer_reviews.title: So Awesome
customer_reviews.text: My fiancé put it together for me yesterday. We took it for a brief spin bcuz it was cold out but so far so good! I'm a 5' 4" female. I scored the small frame size at 100 bucks! Its perfect size and an awesome deal. I had a Schwinn 700c that was much bigger and heavier. I can keep up to my fiancé better on this. My sister and law stopped over and wanted one immediately but when we brought it up on amazon the deal was gone and it was up to $269. This was a great buy. Hope it hold up. Sharp looking too.
customer_reviews.author: maryjane

customer_reviews.title: Ok.  Needs a lot of after market upgrades.
customer_reviews.text: This bike is not a cruiser and is not a road bike. Its a “hybrid” in name but definitely isn’t the best of both worlds. The handles are really small, maybe 3” long beyond the shifter part. The pedals are small, about half the width of my foot. The seat is BRUTAL! You’ll need an aftermarket seat immediately. See the stock phot of the bike? Where the handlebars are above the seat? Yea... you’re gonna need a handlebar extender as well unless you’re 5’ tall with short legs. Beyond that, it rides well on prepared surfaces. I do not recommend taking this bike with its narrow tires off curbs or on dirt or even grass.
customer_reviews.author: mattyk

product_meta.title: Retrospec Barron Comfort Hybrid Bike 21-Speed with Front Suspension and 700c Wheels with Multi-Surface Tires
product_meta.description: Not all roads are created equal, which is why we designed the Barron to conquer them all. Engineered to quickly adapt to any surface, whether cycling through the manhole covered city streets, trekking up steep hills, or taking a casual ride down your local bike trail, the Barron was built to ensure you arrive with ease. A lightweight aluminum frame provides strength and agility while its Zoom suspension fork absorbs the shock of the road, ensuring an enjoyable ride. The Barron's upright handlebars add a level of comfort by allowing for a more natural and relaxed riding position. The Kenda Kwest tires come equipped with a semi slick tread and water dispersion grooves to provide all weather versatility and the ability to ride in just about any environment. Equipped with name brand components such as a Shimano Tourney 21 speed drivetrain and Mega range gearing, this bike allows for fast and easy gear changes, which makes cycling for your commute, fitness, or weekend ride a gratifying experience. Additional features such as a comfort saddle, twist grip shifters, ergonomic brake levers and a sturdy rear mount kickstand provide everything you need for a day spent gallivanting through a variety of terrains.
feature_bullets: Men's 21-speed Hybrid bike with sturdy yet lightweight 6061 aluminum frame designed to take on a variety of terrains
Zoom suspension fork soaks up the bumps for increased comfort and improved handling
Kenda Kwest road tires feature a semi slick tread for low rolling resistance and water dispersion grooves for all weather riding
Brand components such as a Shimano Tourney 21 speed drivetrain for easy reliable shifting & Mega range gearing to help you tackle the steepest hills
Complete with comfortable upright handlebars, comfort saddle, twist grip shifters, ergonomic brake levers, and a sturdy rear mount kickstand.
